tasks.task: Conducting agricultural practices on a 50-acre vegetable farm.
subtasks: Performing soil preparation for planting.

tasks.task: Implementing crop rotation and organic farming methods.
Managing compost production on the farm.
Conducting agricultural practices on a 50-acre vegetable farm.
Operating farming equipment for soil and compost management.
subtasks: Driving a moldboard plow for initial soil preparation.
Applying compost (20 yards per acre) after plowing.
Discarrowing the field (2-3 passes) to integrate soil and compost.
Timing cover crop tilling based on maturity (mid-May for rye and vetch).
Receiving raw dairy manure from a local farm.
Mixing manure with straw.
Constructing and maintaining compost windrows.
Turning the compost with a bucket loader every 2-3 weeks.
Using the compost on fields to fertilize crops.

Therefore, maybe his main focus is on the soil preparation and cover crop management. Therefore, those can be considered as two main tasks, with subtasks for each. Hence, the answer would look like the listed MAINTASKs and SUBTASKs above.

tasks.task: Conducting agricultural practices on a 50-acre vegetable farm.**
Operating farming equipment for soil and compost management.**
Conducting agricultural practices on a 50-acre vegetable farm.
subtasks: Performing soil preparation for planting.
Crop rotation and management.
Cover crop management.
Soil testing and fertilization.

tasks.task: Operating farming equipment for soil and compost management.
subtasks: Driving a moldboard plow for initial soil turning.
Applying compost using appropriate equipment.
Discarrowing the field to prepare the bed.
Managing cover crop tilling.
Receiving and mixing raw dairy manure with straw.
Constructing and maintaining compost windrows.
Turning compost with a bucket loader.
Applying compost to fields.
